metadata.title: CVE-2021-47612 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: nfc:fix segfault in nfc_genl_dump_devices_done When kmalloc innfc_genl_dump_devices() fails then nfc_genl_dump_devices_done() segfaultsas below KASAN: null-ptr-deref in range[0x0000000000000008-0x000000000000000f] CPU: 0 PID: 25 Comm: kworker/0:1Not tainted 5.16.0-rc4-01180-g2a987e65025e-dirty #5 Hardware name: QEMUStandard PC (i440FX + PIIX, 1996), BIOS 1.14.0-6.fc35 04/01/2014 Workqueue:events netlink_sock_destruct_work RIP: 0010:klist_iter_exit+0x26/0x80 CallTrace: <TASK> class_dev_iter_exit+0x15/0x20nfc_genl_dump_devices_done+0x3b/0x50 genl_lock_done+0x84/0xd0netlink_sock_destruct+0x8f/0x270 __sk_destruct+0x64/0x3b0sk_destruct+0xa8/0xd0 __sk_free+0x2e8/0x3d0 sk_free+0x51/0x90netlink_sock_destruct_work+0x1c/0x20 process_one_work+0x411/0x710worker_thread+0x6fd/0xa80

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
